thread.title: River Hill soccer standout Mike Heitzmann selected to play in All-American game
thread.title_full: River Hill soccer standout Mike Heitzmann selected to play in All-American game

author: Glenn Graham
title: River Hill soccer standout Mike Heitzmann selected to play in All-American game
text:
River Hill soccer standout Mike Heitzmann selected to play in All-American game Michael Heitzmann Daniel Kucin Jr. / Baltimore Sun Media Group 
River Hill defender Ben Peters, left, celebrates with River Hill midfielder Michael Heitzmann (2). Heitzmann scored a goal during a high school boys soccer playoff game against Reservoir in Clarksville on Nov. 1, 2013. 
River Hill defender Ben Peters, left, celebrates with River Hill midfielder Michael Heitzmann (2). Heitzmann scored a goal during a high school boys soccer playoff game against Reservoir in Clarksville on Nov. 1, 2013. (Daniel Kucin Jr. / Baltimore Sun Media Group) Glenn Graham Contact Reporter The Baltimore Sun River Hill soccer standout Mike Heitzmann selected to play in High School All-American Game. 
River Hill soccer standout Mike Heitzmann, an All-Metro first-team midfielder, has been selected to play in the fifth annual High School All-American Game, set for Dec. 5 in Raleigh, N.C. 
Heitzmann is one of 20 players chosen to play on the East roster. 
A four-year starter, Heitzmann has eight goals and three assists for the No. 7 Hawks. Last season, he finished with 12 goals and six assists to lead River Hill to the Class 3A state championship. The Maryland commit has 35 goals and 12 assists in his four years.
